release.action: Added input names to action descriptions and @Expose (reflection works only with Java 8 and if compiled with '-parameters' flag).
New methods to invoke actions in parallel.
Directories synchronize faster, even if the advertisement interval is increased to save resources.
Alive and advertisement intervals may differ between nodes of the same platform.
New getter and setter to manage inheritance of log level between node, agent and bean.
ReactiveExecutionCycle for handling action requests and action results immediately.
Logging framework changed from CommonsLogging to Log4j to ensure that log level of agent nodes can be changed and socket appender can be added at runtime.
SSL functionality for management interface and agent communication.
Semantic annotation and matching of actions.
Multiple return types for exposed methods.
ActiveMQ version updated.
Structured information about exchanged messages and performed actions, which are available in jConsole.
Several bugs fixed.
MAMS demonstrator - Contains the scheduled deployment of JADL services by consideration of the load of the agent nodes.
New release of ASGARD with new features and a changed module structure.
Auction example - Usage of VSDT, AWE, JADL, and Rules.
The JMX names of all managed JIAC resources contains the unique ID instead the name of the corresponding agent node.
New module agentCoreAPI which contains all operational and management interfaces of agentCore. Thus, agentCore is now only the implementation of this interfaces.
ASGARD - JIAC V Agent Platform Monitor - 3D!
AgentUnit - Unit testing of JIAC V agent services made easier.
New agent migration allows an agent to migrate from one agent node to another.
Deployment of JADL scripts now uses load distribution.
New module with first implementation of BDI control.
Service matcher example - Searching for semantically described services.
User management example - Use of the usermanagement services and user authorization for service invocations.
Reimplementation of the distributed service directory.
Load measurement more robust.
Load distribution during starttime.

JADL++ improved!!: based on Eclipse TMF v0.7.1; services published in IDirectory; new headers (import, include, mapping, define); new modifier for numeric datatypes; new events (message, time); new control flow (switch-case); new commands (listen, receive, send).
New agent persistence provides an agent node bean to make agent node configurations persistent.
New agent scheduler provides an agent bean to schedule new agents on available agent nodes based on load info and some load related services.
Integration of IRML user management as basic service module with flexible user agent authentication and authorisation of JIAC actions.
New ParlayX client providing an agent bean with actions for accessing IMS/SIP services via ParlayX web services.
Timer-based start and stop of agents.
Flexible token-based authorisation for JIAC action invocations.
A gateway for reliable host name resolution for agent discovery and inter-agent communication.
OWL support in JADL++ interpreter and service matcher.
A service matcher matching OWL-S service descriptions.
Improvement of JADL++ interpreter.

Rule engine API and Drools support has been extracted from JIAC and established as own independent module for use in other DAI-Labor projects without JIAC. Integration of ruleengine into JIAC agents is now build on top of it.
Non-blocking execution cycle supports parallel action execution and synchronous action invocation.
New extensible management client API for easy management of local or remote JIAC TNG resources.
Services are now reliably discovered by using the service directory if they are there, also cross-node.
SessionIds are now passed down to sub-services during service usage.
New load measurement provides an agent bean and java classes for measuring system load on an agent node.
Some improvements and changes on the web server module.
RuleEngineMonitor - Tool for remote monitoring and control of JIAC rule engines.
Several new features added to the agent node monitor.
New rule engine support for JIAC agents.
Interpreter example - Use of a JADL++ Interpreter to execute composed services.
Ping Pong example - Communication between agents of an agent node by using message bus and directory service.
AgentNodeMonitor - Comprehensive graphical tool for remote monitoring and control of agent nodes and agents.
New web server beans with services for enabling and disabling web applications.
Simple chat example - Communication between agents and dynamic creation of agents.
Hello World example - Invocation of an action between loosely coupled components of an agent.

Additionally to the normal source and test code structure a site will be created which provides basic information about the module on the one hand, and information about the quality of the module on the other.
You may now log your changes in a ChangeLog using this changes.xml. A report will be generated automatically and integrated in the site.
Strict mode support added to "de.dailab.jiactng.agentcore.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleHandler".
